answerText: rings[10] These subsets of rings are closed under addition and super-closed under multiplication. Examples include maximal, prime, and radical ones.
heading: ACF Winter |2009 | Brown University and Notre Dame | 15 | Science | Math | College
subject: Science
question: Question: A fundamental result in algebraic geometry requires much technical work in commutative algebra. FTPE: [10] Much of commutative algebra concerns these structures, which specialize to integral domains when they contain no zero divisors and fields when their non-zero elements form an abelian group under multiplication.
